etymology.description: Phonetic: 昜(昜) (yáng, "sunshine") + Semantic: 阜(阜) (fù, "hill") -> Brightness or influence from a hill exposed to the sun, extended to mean "male" or "positive."
etymology.interpretation: Originally, 昜(昜) (yáng, "sunshine") depicted sunlight. The addition of 阜(阜) (fù, "hill") emphasizes exposure to sunlight on a hill, leading to the association with brightness or positivity.
etymology.simplification: 阳(陽) simplifies the traditional 陽 by replacing 昜(昜) with 日(日) (rì, "sun"), reflecting the focus on sunlight in the character's meaning.

examples.chinese: 他是家中的阳(他是家中的陽)。
examples.english: He is the male figure in the family.

examples.chinese: 在这场运动会上(在這場運動會上)，他的阳性能量感染了队友(他的陽性能量感染了隊友)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhè chǎng yùndònghuì shàng, tā de yángnéng liàng gǎnrǎn le duìyǒu.
examples.english: At this sports meet, his positive energy inspired his teammates.
